titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Henry Limrick, Wm H. Shryock, Riley Oder, and Joseph Simpson, Indictment
CWG7262

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Grand Circuit Court.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky. Plaintiff.
against } Indictment for Murder.
Henry Limrick, Wm H. Shryock, Riley Oder & Joseph Simpson Defendants

The Grand Jury of Grant County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Henry Limrick, Wm H. Shryock, Riley Oder & Joseph Simpson of the offense of murder, committed as follows, viz: The said Henry Limrick, Wm H. Shriock, Riley Oder & Joseph Simpson, in the county, Circuit, and State aforesaid, on the day of February 1864, did feloniously, wickedly, corruptly, and with malice aforethought kill and murder George W. Jamison by then and there shooting the said Jamison in the body. with a gun loaded with powder and leaden ball, or other hard substance thereby inflicting a dangerous and mortal wound upon the body and person of the said Jamison, from the effects of said wound so inflicted the said Jamison then and there died immediately. Contrary to the Statute in such cases made and provided -- and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky --

John L. Scott.
Commonwealths attorney for 8th Judicial District.

witnesses for Commonwealth --
J. R. Jamison --
G W. Nichols --
Charles OHara --
Morgan Simpson --
T. J. McGinnis --
T. L. Clark --

Endorsed.
"A true Bill T. S. Jeffers foreman"
Filed October 28th 1865."
A copy Att.
N H. Jeffers C, G, c, c,

Commonwealth
vs } Copy of Indict.
Limrick & others
